website_summaries.verdict: Earns our top spot for bright light, durability, and long warranty. The best choice for almost any landscape lighting need.
cons: The light has a cooler hue than some users would prefer

customer_reviews.title: Love these lights
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. They throw out an incredible amount of light for being solar garden lights. I can't wait to buy more. What everyone says about the cheap plastic stake is true, so push the stake into the ground first, then put the light on top. To reposition, remove the light, remove the stake and then re-insert it where you want it. They look great and have a consistent brightness and sharpness. The "star burst" light pattern looks really nice too. One of the things I hated about solar lights is how wimpy they look, their lack of actual useful light output and the fact the batteries die quickly. These solve all those problems.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Not Working Anymore
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a set of these a few years back and they were high quality and are still nice a bright today. Because of my experience with those I purchased 2 more sets (not cheap) and I was sadly disappointed as soon as I opened the box. The quality was not the same but I thought it was just me. Unfortunately it was not just me as 3 lights no longer work. I even purchased replacement batteries and still did not work. To make this an even worse experience is the lights stopped working after the return window closed so be very careful!!!
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Good when new, has a history of failing
customer_reviews.text: They look good when new if you overlook the cheesy brown paint that they try to pass off as oil rubbed bronze. The light output is excellent. The support stake is flimsy, way too small for a light of this size and weight. My older Richmond lights have lost their paint and some have had the LED's fail. They don't fail totally, just one LED out of the pair. It would be nice if someone from Moonrays would contact me about getting these failed LED's replaced and also the one's that have lost their finish.
customer_reviews.author: John D Stewart

customer_reviews.title: They're just beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lights. Because the light radiates out like rays, it looks like fireworks going off around our pond. If there was any complaint at all it is that they seemed much brighter the first night than they do now, a week later. PRO.....replaceable rechargeable batteries and glass globes instead of plastic. For people who have complained about the plastic spikes, my husband but the spike into the ground FIRST and then attached the lights. No problems. After reading the reviews, we had planned to cut and hammer pvc conduit into the ground and inserting the spikes but it wasn't necessary.
customer_reviews.author: L.H.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Units
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a number of these units and like them for the brightness. However, they have a high number of defective units out of the box, especially considering the high price of the units. I just returned a set for that very problem and requested they be replaced. I was sent units which were used and showed distinctive signs of weathering and missing the stakes that hold them into the ground. Someone needs to pay more attention to quality control. The ones that do work do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: SS2

customer_reviews.title: Great Patio and Walkway Lights
customer_reviews.text: These lights are extremely easy to install. Snap two pieces together and then stick the lights where you want them to go in your yard. I use them as pathway lights in an area where it is partially shaded. Where one light is placed, it is a little too shady, so it doesn’t get a bright as the others; however, the other 3 shine brightly at night. These are much less expensive than having lights installed (I was quoted $700). They are attractive and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: GolfWife

customer_reviews.title: Best solar light and super bright.  Will last all night
customer_reviews.text: Best solar lights at a great value. Super bright and it will last all night even in Washington State's dark winters and short daylight hours. Has 3 powerful AA solar batteries that are 1500 mAh which provide enough stored power to last all night. Only drawback is the plastic stakes. They break easily if you bent or knock down the unit while it is in the ground. Extra stakes use to be available for $2 at cci-parts but they are currently undergoing a transition. Call moonray's customer service to find out when parts will be made available. Still a great product, just be careful about the stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: One of the two lights is defective. The glass cup fills with water after a rainstorm and now the unit no longer works. I have called the company phone number 3 times and left messages and written them an email. No response. It appears they do not honor their one-year warranty. The other light works fine, but one of the ones I received was a lemon. Very disappointed. UPDATE: After numerous tries, I finally reached customer service and they replaced the solar light that was defective as well as another one in the box. I changed my review from 1 to 4 stars, since Customer Service finally stepped up.
customer_reviews.author: corky

customer_reviews.title: Good lights, crummy batteries
customer_reviews.text: These lights are very nice in themselves. Blindingly bright LEDs, with low power drain. However, the batteries (only 1000 mah) they came with were lousy. When attempting to charge them up, they leaked and nearly ruined my charger. I replaced them with Ray-O-Vac 2100mah NIMH batteries (4/$7.47 at my local Wal-Mart - total $14.94), and the lights lasted about 11 hours (until daylight) before becoming too dim to be useful. They charged up nicely, however, in partial sun on a bright, sunny day. I like the lights. Be advised: These lights require 3 AA NIMH batteries of at least 2000mah capacity for each light. Not super cheap, but worth the extra $.
customer_reviews.author: G. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Good For The Money, But Not That Bright...
customer_reviews.text: These lights are pretty high quality construction, glass and metal. Not cheap plastic like other ones. I like the light pattern that they cast too. But on the other hand, they don't hold a charge very well. Was a little bit disappointed with that. They are very bight for about 3-4 hours, then get at least 50% less bright. Within 6 hours, they are very dim. The ones that I had prior to these stayed 70-80% bright for at least 8-10 hours. BTW, I live in Florida, so daily sunshine is not a problem here. But for the money, I guess they are OK.
customer_reviews.author: Dan - Pool And Spa

customer_reviews.title: These solars are the best you will find as far as brightness is concerned.
customer_reviews.text: I love the strength of these solars. They also cast a beautiful light pattern on the ground. Generally last about 2 years. The negative of these is the cost which continuously is escalating. I have ordered about 22 times in the last three years. They have nearly doubled in cost over that period, and frequently snap when inserting into the ground. I buy metal rods and push into the ground and slide the metal posts over them, This further increases the cost. Just purchased 6 more sets at the end of March for $39 and in 12 days, they have gone to $52. But if cost is not an issue, get these.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great Light,  but 1/3 of the lights stopped working
customer_reviews.text: 1st, these lights are bright. 2nd, 2 of the 6 light bought totally quit working after 2 seasons. I live in cold weather and store them inside every winter. I tried to fix & replaced the solar batteries hoping that work fix the problem, but no. I bought at $33, I see they are now over $50, for that price, they should last 3-4 seaaons. 3rd, these are not warm light color spectrum, more cool whitw (look at photos in reviews).
customer_reviews.author: Tbone

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful looking and very bright
customer_reviews.text: We have bought 8 of these by now. The brightest solar lights we have ever found, even in days when they received very minimal sunlight. The beam is very attractive due to the cut glass. I only gave 4 stars due to the fact that the stake to put in the ground is plastic. In our hard baked soil it was impossible to get the stake to go in the ground or to hold once it rains. In the end my husband cut a piece of steel rod for each light and drove it in the ground and the lights fit perfectly on it and stand straight and solid.
customer_reviews.author: elfi s.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome White Light and Not the Soft White Kinds
customer_reviews.text: Most of these things comes in yellow light (soft white). This thing is close to "cool" white. It contains three AA batteries meaning it'll should last longer at night. Not going to measure the longevity of the light! too many variables. -1 Star for scuff solar panels. Mine has scratches on it. I was going to return it but after spraying it with water, the dry water marks are a lot worst. These things are like install and forget kind of products. If I think too much about it, I am going to return it. So picking the right one is important.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: 5 year purchaser These lights are losing their luster for me
customer_reviews.text: Have been ordering these for years, 30 or more. They are attractive and burn brightly. The more I install the more places my wife says we need additional lights. And after several years the first sets are failing and need not one but three rechargeable batteries at $1+ each. The other issue is the paint coating burns off in the AZ sun in just over a year. The price has gone up substantially and to make matters worse there was one dud that three more batteries fixed. Second time that has happened. Forgive the mediocre pun.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very disapointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets of these lights in January. It is May and 2 of the four lights I purchased have completely died. I even tried recharging the batteries and they are fine. These lights are definitely not worth it. I thought spending the extra money would get a better light. Wrong!
customer_reviews.author: MissPatti

customer_reviews.title: they are cool white. They do not have warm white lights ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 6 of these lights. Problems with 2 of them. When they work, they work really well. Thought they would be warm white in color, they are not, they are cool white. They do not have warm white lights which was a disappointment. Been in contact with customer service a few times. Very response and are helping to correct the problem(s). Make sure you check the batteries! The ones supplied, their own, have some defects in them and will not hold the charge after 2/3 hours. Changed batteries and unit worked fine. Sure is a different light, nice.....
customer_reviews.author: JDK

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought and installed 6 of these in Nov. 2019. All worked great. After 4 months, I started noticing that they wouldn't last as long as they did initially. Perhaps winter weather / less sunlight didn't allow them to charge fully during the day? at 5 months two would consistently go dark before midnight. Not a big deal, but they should all perform the same. By summer, one of the two failed completely. Opened it up and the LED board and charger board were corroded badly which caused the failure most likely. I noticed that the NiMH batteries were 1500 mAh. I think these would be 4 star if they had better batteries - 2000 mAh or more.
customer_reviews.author: RPK2

customer_reviews.title: Nice yard lights, but
customer_reviews.text: On the bright side (hahaha) these lights are quite lovely when situated in the perfect location to receive enough sunlight to fully charge them. I liked the first 2 so much, I bought another pair. However, as noted in some prior reviews the stakes can be problematical. One little accidental bump and the top of the stake breaks off and down comes the light. There is no recourse at that point. I would suggest the manufacturer make the stakes out of much sturdier material and/or at the very least offer replacement stakes for sale.
customer_reviews.author: MellowRose

customer_reviews.title: Out of 3 sets, 1 light leaked
customer_reviews.text: Pretty bummed about finding out the reason my "secret garden" light in the back wasn't working was because it looked like a goldfish bowl on the inside. Rusted out everything. I can only assume the solar panel screen wasn't sealed, as there's no other way for water to enter the globe. The other 5 are cranking away, and the light is, indeed, beautiful and very bright. But I have to think twice about reordering, as this is a pretty expensive "fail." As well, two of the plastic stakes have snapped off with relatively little pressure, so that often mentioned defect is still very much an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Beege Welborn

customer_reviews.title: Moonrays 91754 Richmond Solar LED Path Light
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Moonrays 91754 Richmond Solar LED Path Light. We ordered two of these lights just over a year ago. One light stopped working so we ordered a replacement. When we removed the defective light we discovered that the light leaked rain water into the glass housing and the water shorted out the electronics. We like the light but it should last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha Christie

customer_reviews.title: Brightest I've found
customer_reviews.text: These are nice bright pathway lights. My only complaint is that they seem much more of a cool white than a warm one, compared to other solar leds that I've owned over the years. Very reliable so far (I've had them less than 2 months), and seem to be sturdy and well-made. They give out a nice star pattern, rather than an overall circle of light.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts about 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a set of two of these for three years and they worked great until a few months ago. Then they started to dim. I replaced the rechargeable batteries, and also cleaned the solar panels. The first night the light was back to normal. But then the light dimmed significantly and has remained dim. Since the new batteries brought the light back to the way it was, I assume the problem is that either the solar panels have worn out or there is something wrong with the charging system. I got three good years out of these, but after that the brightness was a fraction of what it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: AGWVT

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous illumination and long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: These solar lights are amazing. The illumination is bright and gorgeos! I'm in South Florida and we obviously get sun all day day long. The lights are on through the early morning and until the sun rises...holy smokes! The only issue I find is that the light fixtures come with a plastic stakes to drive into the grass, which break pretty easily. Wish those stakes were metal. I did email the company and they sent me a few replacements early on for free! As time goes on, I will need to purchase several due to having recent accidents resulting in more damaged stakes though
customer_reviews.author: Sandy N

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later, still bright strong light
customer_reviews.text: I am sitting in my back yard, appreciating these lights and I realize that I purchased them 4 years ago! Each of them is still going strong, recharging and shining brightly at night. The plastic stakes are not as strong as I would like but have endured several moves. I have gently relocated these several times, from a shaded home in a Connecticut to an urban backyard in the mid Atlantic. For a couple of years, I have used one of these as a garden tabletop lamp by inserting it into a potted tabletop plant. Great purchase, no regrets after 4 years!
customer_reviews.author: Curious

customer_reviews.title: Quality Solar LED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a couple of these more than five years ago. They were outdoors summer AND WINTER (Northern New England winter). They finally stopped working, so I bought two more. The solar panel is housed in the metal cover and the light shines out through a thick, ribbed glass globe. They are powered by 3 AA rechargeable batteries that are widely available. Very happy with these well-constructed, elegant solar lights.
customer_reviews.author: Russell M. Brady

customer_reviews.title: love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Finally ! Good size and light output...haven't had long enough to rate durability ..but they stay on longer and put out more light than others I've bought ..a little more expensive than some but worth it...THANK YOU PS had a little while now and we have had overcast skys now for 10 days or so ??? Seems forever ...and theses are still lighting up ...good job !
customer_reviews.author: leslie johns

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but didn’t last....
customer_reviews.text: These are good looking solar lights. I bought two pair to place along the shore of our lake. I’d give them 5 stars but one of the lights just quit working. It was fine one night but the next night it wouldn’t light up. It was only a month old but just outside of the return date. These lights are too expensive to replace them every few months, especially when I have other solar lights in the yard that are still working fine after several years. **UPDATE 1 year later and we now have 4 out of 12 not working. I’m told the sensors went bad on all four. This is unacceptable. These aren’t cheap lights.
customer_reviews.author: Dusguicheon

customer_reviews.title: Bright. Fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Bright - these use 3 batteries so they are much brighter and last longer than other solar lights. the solar panel area is also much larger. They are made out of metal and glass, but the connection from the top glass/light part to the pole is through a small piece of plastic. If you knock them over, they will break. I think of the 6 I purchased, 2 broke before I even got them installed. 2 more broke when they were bumped by lawn equipment. I'm still looking for the right glue to hold these together. I hope the engineer that designed these, or the finance guy who cheeped out on the design got fired.
customer_reviews.author: jlboygenius

customer_reviews.title: Bright, Long Illuminating Solar Lights
customer_reviews.text: We use these lights to aluminate the my front walkway to the front porch and the steps down from the back deck. We have tried other solar lights and they either degrade and become unreliable or only illuminate for short duration, making them useless. We purchased the first two Moonrays a year ago and they are still working fine. After disappointment with other brands we purchased more recently. These are Larger, about 2X the size in circumference, than most solar lights. Also, they have an excessively fragile connection between the globe and rod that sticks in the ground. Even so, they illuminate all night! Would be 5 star if they were more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: sauceonyapasta

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but fragile lights.
customer_reviews.text: I love the looks of these lights and they are beautiful when they work, but two of them have already gotten water in and ruined them within a year. If they could just seal the tops better, they would be a great product. Expensive if they only last a year. Update: After a year all but one stopped working because water leaks into them from the top. If they didn't leak they would be the best, but NOT RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: bhnova

customer_reviews.title: Good lights but lousy spikes
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 2 years later, the lights are still very bright and last most of the night. Problem--the plastic spikes that goes into the ground break off very easily. If you ever need to move these lights, the spikes will probably break off. It's a shame because I otherwise like the lights. I bought a replacement set and super glued the spikes to the metal posts. Maybe these won't break so easily. 6 months out, I am still happy with these lights. Well made and continue to work very well. They do get dim if you have a cloudy day. 2 cloudy days and they are pretty much done.
customer_reviews.author: a cook

customer_reviews.title: Wiring not great
customer_reviews.text: Loved the brightness and the appearance, but after purchasing two sets of the lights I found that both sets had wiring issues. Lights would not come on all the time, so after checking I found that the wires were loose or disconnected and not easy to fix as they are very thin to work with. I have 4 lights now. One does not work at all and the other three work when they feel like it or I tap them with my hand. Have given up on taking them apart to rewire. Great lights if they just worked consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J Palmisano

customer_reviews.title: Will purchase more
customer_reviews.text: I agree that the metal tube/post is very thin and liable to bending - more cosmetic than structural. I'm trying to figure out something sturdy - maybe rebar to put inside it. Once I figure that out, will purchase more for my yard. They last all night, though the light does become progressively weaker. Most important thing is that they light well in the evening when you are more likely to be out in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela H.

customer_reviews.title: Bright
customer_reviews.text: These are slightly larger than the average solar light. They are also bright enough to be useful, and the light makes an interesting striped pattern on the ground. They come with good 2000mAh batteries (3 each) so the light lasts almost through the night, and the included batteries worked for about 3 years. I'm replacing batteries now, but the solar chargers and LEDs and still going strong - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ken J.

customer_reviews.title: Both of the units do not perform the same.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. There are two units in this package. One light is about ten times brighter than the other. Not sure if it's the battery, or what. But returning it isn't a good option since I had to install in the yard and let a few days go by before I could be sure if the prblem and in the meantime I threw the packaging away.
customer_reviews.author: S. Derek Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Great solar lights - but with a flaw
customer_reviews.text: These are the most substantial, durable, and nicest looking of any outdoor solar lamps that I've seen. But now that I've owned a number of them, I have to say that they have a fatal flaw: a crucial part that tends to break while the rest of the lamp is in fine shape. There is a brown plastic pin that you sink into the ground like a stake and on which you install the lamp. This pin tends is made of cheap plastic and it snaps easily. Without it, the lamp is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M

customer_reviews.title: Very short working life; beautiful until they fail
customer_reviews.text: I prefer praising a product than criticizing one. In this case, buyers should be aware that these Moonrays only last about 18 mos. to 2 years. The light fails, and it is not the batteries. The coating on the outside of the lights on top, near the solar panel, also chips away during that time. I have bought this product twice, and just cannot do it again with it failing like this. I do keep them out all year round, including through the winter. The light is very pretty. Thought they would last longer. Customer service is also poor; no response to my email after one week. I may try to call.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Levin

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months, no longer lighting up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set of two 6 months ago to replace some that were no longer working and these two quit working just a few months later. I've changed the batteries but they barely work. It's a shame because now I feel I have to replace all 6 with a different brand ... $30 is too much to test another two out to see if I just got a bad shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a year ago. Easy to install over some 3/4 inch re-bar that I had lying around. Put them at the end of my driveway and they were nice and bright for about 4 months. Over the next 6 months they got progressively dimmer and then one stopped working altogether. It’s been a year now and the last one barely casts enough light to hit tre ground 15 inches below the fixture. Will have to look for something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Art F.  - Franklin, TN

customer_reviews.title: Great light output
customer_reviews.text: I have about 20 of these around my pool and landscaping. They are very bright and have last well for 4+ years. I have lost 2 units that just quit working. Replaced batteries in these and still not working, never replaced batteries in the other units. They still last most of the night during the summer (Atlanta, GA). On longer winter nights they are no longer illuminated in the AM. I threw out the cheap plastic stakes and used 12"-14" pieces of rebar pushed into the dirt to hold lamps upright.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great lights but “cool” coloring
customer_reviews.text: First of all, these definitely are not warm “yellow” LED lights. They put off a cool “white” LED color. However they are very bright and last several hours even after an overcast midwestern sky all day. To correct the color, I bought a relatively inexpensive sheet of photography lighting color correcting gel and taped a small square over each light. You can see the before (left) and after (right) in the photo. These are just about perfect now! I own 6 lights and just ordered another set. Color filter sheets:
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Great but ....
customer_reviews.text: Really like these lights, that said, of the 4 sets I ordered one light is extremely faint in spite of direct sun recharge location. Not sure what is going on. To pack these up and return is a pain. Updated review, two weeks after installing...had to replace batteries in one light, two others stopped working after being rained on. Had to brush off water and tap top to turn on..very finicky. These are not inexpensive lights. They are great when they work but....would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of these lights and took them to Brasil and installed them in the yard. They are lovely and quite bright and the battery capacity is sufficient to last the night. One of the grand-kids accidentally knocked one over and broke the plastic spike that goes into the mounting tube and is inserted in the ground. I contacted the company and they promptly resolved the issue to our satisfaction. They were courteous and respectful in the quick response to my inquiry. This company has great customer service and sell a great product.
customer_reviews.author: LiaBia

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright LED lights
customer_reviews.text: Received in two days with Amazon Prime. Solar LED lights were very well packaged, went together easily, and were very bright. As some have suggested the post anchor is made of plastic and seems a bit flimsy. I already had holes from previous lights, so these went in the ground easily. It would be nice if Amazon also had stronger posts available. I had previously purchased solar led path lights that were supposed to be the brightest lights at 70 lumens, but these lights are brighter.
customer_reviews.author: Richard & Diane Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Love these solar lights!
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights, I bought several for my previous house and since I moved it was one of the first things i bought for the new house. I have them all around the outside of the house and front walk. A few of them have stopped working on the past but manufacturer good about replacing if needed. Makes this house feel like home while gently lighting up where needed.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Very bright, long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, these are very bright. Definitely the brightest I've used. After a month, they are still working well. It's early November, so the days are getting pretty short, and they still last at least 6-7 hours if it's a sunny day. We'll see if they still work in a year...
customer_reviews.author: dennisb

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 boxes (4 lights total). These lights worked great at first. One of the lights got full of water from rain and never worked again. I thought they were waterproof. I ordered new batteries thinking maybe that would work...but it didn't! So then another light went out. So now I have two lights that work and two lights that don't. I honestly think the company should replace the 2 lights that went out, or they will have a very disappointed customer !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MOONRAYS 91754 BRONZE SOLAR LIGHT
customer_reviews.text: These lights are absolutely great. Metal with glass. Very bright and long lasting. I live in Maine and even now at the end of October they still stay lit til dawn (assuming a partly sunny day to charge them). We now own 20 of them and have them scattered about. One light failed and stopped lighting, so I e-mailed them to see about repair. They just sent me a new fixture. Where I want the fixture a little higher I use a 18" 3/4 galvanized pipe and just put the fixture sleeve right over the pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Smith

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT LAST 3 Month
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the End of October 2018 and two have stopped working 1/18/2019. I have left them out in full sunlight and (I Live in So. Florida) they still will not work. WOULD LIKE THEM REPLACED!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Russ

customer_reviews.title: High Quality and Will purchase again. Only TWO in a box.
customer_reviews.text: There are only 2 to a box. Rememer that! However, they are superb. I will be purchasing again because I would like to have these line my walk way all the way up to the front door. Compared to Lowe's, Home Depot, or any other store, these particular ones are not sold but the other brands are ranged from similiar to higher priced and they do NOT deliver like these do. It is worth to just purchase however many are needed for your walk way. They are bigger than I first thought but am pleasantly surprised. The charge holds well into the night.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L. Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 last year. Love them so I bought 2 more this year. Very bright, and throw off a lot of light. If people push the stakes in the ground and not push on the top of lights, they wouldn't break as some mentioned! Last years are still going strong by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K. Holsted

customer_reviews.title: One of brightest solar landscape lights
customer_reviews.text: These are the brightest solar landscape lights that I could find. They work well though I wish they had a brighter brass finish. Assembly was super easy though the instructions talked about a power switch that I never could find. Apparently, there is only a piece of paper to remove to expose a battery terminal.
customer_reviews.author: MacJay

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, cool light
customer_reviews.text: Larger than I had expected. Workmanship is very high quality and they look great. The lights are very bright and they display a pretty star pattern. They charge well and last from dusk past midnight (haven't timed exactly when they go out.) Very sturdy. The advertisement said "warm light" which I specifically looked for to match other low voltage lighting in my back yard. These lights however are not warm but cool. Definitely above 3000K and more like 4000K. (2700K is warm).
customer_reviews.author: Family Man

customer_reviews.title: These are really good-looking path lights!
customer_reviews.text: I have six of these leading up to my front door. They look really good and last all night. I go to work at 5AM and they're still shining when I walk past every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Really bright.
customer_reviews.text: Have bought three sets of these solar lamps for my front and back yards, and haven't encountered any issues with breakage, despite the large amounts of red clay in my soil content. Actually just assembled them in full, and carefully used my weight to press them down leaving but two-three inches between the surface and glass/light splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Solar Lights!
customer_reviews.text: The lights are very bright and had no problems with installation. Highly recommend. We had only one problem. We had the lights placed in our backyard and some of them were in the path of our sprinklers. After a few months the dusk to dawn feature stopped working so lights stayed on all the time and the battery could not charge sufficiently for dark hours. I purchased clear potted plant trays and placed them on top of the lights. This solved the problem perfectly. They sre very inexpensive and the solar panels work great. I have had them on the lights for over 6 months and still no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sdelbridge

customer_reviews.title: Very weak pole and stake. Light itself is quite good.
customer_reviews.text: The light itself is quite good, but the bottom part is horrible. The pole is only held to the glass by about 1/16 inch of a self tapping screw. The plastic stake at the bottom is way too thin and crumbles if you attempt to force it into anything but soft earth. WARNING: Never attempt to press on the top of the light to drive the stake into the ground. The glass will break free from the pole - due to the very weak attachment as described above.
customer_reviews.author: Maj C. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Good lighting with substandard build
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a year ago. The brightness of the light is great. The post structure supporting the light is a joke. Very flimsy, easily broken. I built new supports using 1" pvc over a steel stake. The bronze color on the light housing is beginning to peel off all 6 units. If you purchase, be prepared to put in some DIY work to make them better.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Different and nice looking
customer_reviews.text: These solar lights are just what I wanted; the dark bronze color and glass are very nice looking. The star-burst pattern that the light provides is unique and very attractive. I didn't give 5 stars because as other reviewers said, the plastic piece that goes from light into stake broke when putting into ground, however, crazy glue saved the day. You must put stake in ground before you attach the light to prevent breaking plastic, otherwise, the lights are fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: ginjello

customer_reviews.title: So far well made solar light.
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased Moonrays brand products before and was pleased. This pair of solar lights were packaged properly, no issues. The light output is quite satisfactory to me. Lights up the dark area on my property much better. These are ground directed solar lights, run on a single moonray battery. Plan to buy some replacement batteries as these lights are made pretty well and looks like they might be around for awhile. Will reevaluate the solar lights after our rainy season. May change to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mtnman

customer_reviews.title: Best Solar's Ever Bought.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a lot of solar "crap" in the past. These work, are very bright and just keep shinning. I'm in my 3rd+ year and getting ready to buy more. Only downside are the stakes. Just be careful driving them in. Mine are fine.
customer_reviews.author: P. E. THEBERGE Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Bright and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I set up 8 of these about a year and a half ago. Light output and quality excellent. Only negative is the plastic stakes are not very stable and tended to tilt over. Easily solved by getting 12 inch by half inch steel pipes from Home Depot and using these to replace the plastic stakes. After one and a half years 4 of the eight were out or not holding charge. One had leaked, fried a circuit board, and had to be replaced. Others are back to new after replacing the rechargeable batteries. These lights appear to have a long life span.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Craigie

customer_reviews.title: 30 Lumens Solar Lights!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for over a month and I will be purchasing more. I only purchased one set and waited to see how they would hold up and I will definitely be purchasing more. They are quite pleasing to have in my back yard along my garden walkway. The light is bright and it has an awesome design that the light casts on the ground; it is designed well and the 30 lumens is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: barb d

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life and obnoxious light pattern
customer_reviews.text: Long battery life if the sky wasn't overcast or cloudy during the day. Obnoxious light pattern that is better when the solar light is higher. I bought PVC tubing and cut it into 18 inch sections. On one end the cut is at 45 degrees. I sanded the PVC tubing, then sprayed it (from a can of matte paint) with black paint. The bottoms of the solar light tubes are about four inches off the ground. The added height makes the light pattern look better.
customer_reviews.author: bob fox

customer_reviews.title: Theft prone, potential durability issues, but does do its light-job nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Three batteries, higher lumens, functioning solar panel...... the math checks out. Issues: the info given does not give the diameter of the support shaft which is important if anchoring the light in a hole, for instance in a wood fence, or drilled concrete. Support shaft appears to be painted steel, prone to rust and wear. No helpful means of securing the light from theft if mounted in a semi-public place, for instance a front yard. /rdt
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality .. one  broke with few days  and other stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Opened and checked the battery noticed it is corroded .. total piece of junk attached are the pictures Top portion seems to be fine and light is bright. But the base is plastic which is very cheap. Broke within 2 days even with loose soil. Second one light stopped working. Even with sunlight it is not working. Piece of junk but a better light with string base.
customer_reviews.author: Sundar

customer_reviews.title: So bright, nice light pattern!
customer_reviews.text: Not big on leaving reviews but these are phenomenal. I had some before these that were so dull it was not even worth having lights. 30 lumens for solar is unheard of. They shine bright right out of the box and the light pattern is very cool. I bought 2 boxes (4 total) to test and see how I liked them and immediately bought 3 more boxes (6 more). Once I do the side of my house with perennials I'll be buying more to line the sidewalk to my side door with these amazing lights!
customer_reviews.author: eric s.

customer_reviews.title: Defective, warranty not honored
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a bunch of these lights over 6 months ago. The stake that goes into the ground is made of a cheap plastic material and two of them broke during a mild windstorm. I contacted Amazon, who directed me to contact the manufacturer. The manufacturer used the COVID-19 pandemic basically as an excuse to state that the product is discontinued and that they cannot help me. Contacted Amazon again, who told me they can't do anything (thought Amazon would be more helpeful), so I am basically stuck holding the bag. Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vahe Zohrabian

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5 stars, if not for the cheap stakes
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side, The lights are nice and bright, the globes are real glass and most of the construction is metal. However, the stakes are cheap plastic and break easily. In the first month, half of them broke. I've fashioned replacements from wood, but shouldn't have to. Update: the connector securing the glass to the metal pole is also cheap plastic, and has a single small screw holding the joint together. We bought 2 packs and all 4 are broken beyond repair in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: NDMurph

customer_reviews.title: Ground stakes are VERY flimsy and break EASILY on installation into ground.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Very bright illumination as compared to other solar pathway lights. Attractive star-like illumination. CONS: Ground stakes break VERY easily. I purchased 8 lights and 3 ground stakes broke off while inserting into ground, even though I was extremely careful. Customer Service does NOT respond to any requests for replacement parts. And I have yet to find any type of substitute ground stake that fits the design of these lights, so the lights are virtually useless if the ground stake is broken.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: disappointed as I had studied many lights prior to purchasing ...
customer_reviews.text: disappointed as I had studied many lights prior to purchasing these. One of them is perfect and I love that one, but the other one doesn't work correctly and is much dimmer than it should be; I have to take the top off and push around on it inside and if I'm lucky it will become brighter for awhile. Due to the inconsistency I cannot recommend these lights.
customer_reviews.author: stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dark steps
customer_reviews.text: These lights are very bright and perfectly light up a dark path in my yard. So far they have worked well. I have tried other solar lights and was disappointed . I hope these continue to work this well.
customer_reviews.author: Sneekers

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for lots of very bright white light!
customer_reviews.text: Whoa this is the second set of Moonrays branded solar lights I have purchased and these are even more bright than the last set I purchased! I got this rubbed bronze finish and it is quite tasteful and perfect for the garden accent lighting where these are used. They are incredibly bright and with better batteries, they stay lit for a full 8 hours on a good full sun charge. I don't think you will be disappointed with these, they are great. Buy, put in better batteries, stake em, and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Winkb

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend--
customer_reviews.text: Let me begin by saying this is only my second review in my life so it's a big deal! This item BY FAR HANDS DOWN with everything I have purchased in the last decade is the best!!! I ordered over 30 of them 2 years ago and I just now replaced the batteries in only two of them. They are made well, illuminate nicely, and as I mentioned the batteries last and last. I attribute that due to great workmanship i.e. sealed so well moisture may not affect batteries. I am getting ready to order a ton more to add to my property for my wedding (functionality and aesthetics)!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way better than what is advertised.
customer_reviews.text: What a great set of lights. I order two sets and am not disappointed but delighted. The lights are high quality, metal and glass. There are two LEDs per light that make them very bright, exactly what I needed. I have placed them along a walkway that has a 2 foot drop off one side. These lights more than light up the pathway and the drop off making me feel a lot safer having people walk. The batteries last for far more than the 8 hours they claim. Mine go on at about 6-7 PM and are still showing full brightness at 5 AM. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: 1 Light doesn't wind
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these light this winter and just installed them.I purchased 10 2 packs and i have 1 defective light that won't work with new batteries installed. Now I'm stuck with a bad light because my return window is closed
customer_reviews.author: karen eddinger

customer_reviews.title: The brightest solar lights compared to the competition.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 1 pack of 2, then was so impressed I ordered four more. Each are about 30 lumens with a run time of 6 hours on sunny days, and 4 hours on cloudy days. Just be sure to pre-dig your hole at the desired depth with a similar sized stake, then plant the assembled pole, and insert the light fixture on top of the planted pole last. I put a little liquid dish soap on the pole ends so the light slides on easily. Mine are still working after four years!
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Lamp is ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Ordered six of these lights. One of them lights up very dim. Swapped location and changed the battery, still same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Errol W. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: The best solar path lights!
customer_reviews.text: These are solid, quality solar path lights. I have been disappointed by other solar lights, but these are the real deal. AND, the amount of light they put out is fantastic--significantly more than any other solar path light I've tried. They also shine a charming diamond pattern onto the path. For more stability, I recommend getting 18" pvc pipes, cutting one end into a point, and hammering them into the ground. Then, put the solar light sleeve onto the pvc. They stand much more straight, and don't move that way.
customer_reviews.author: MaxTex

customer_reviews.title: Time did tell
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch of these about two years ago and they only held up for a little over a year. Fortunately Moonrays was very good to deal with and they sent me a number of replacements.
customer_reviews.author: John McQueston

customer_reviews.title: cost more but (I thought it was) worth it
customer_reviews.text: We had tried some of the cheaper solar path lights and had been pretty unhappy with the output and that some of them had died. I can't comment on longevity yet but we are happier with the increased output. If they last they'll be worth the extra money. I wasn't too impressed at first but then realized we'd had a series of overcast days. I'm pretty good about updating these reviews so If I don't add an update you can assume they are still working fine. update: It's been 6 months and one of the two lights no longer charges properly. If you put a charged battery in it lights brightly until the battery runs down.
customer_reviews.author: doubleganger

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lights.
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely great lights - we put them on our walkway and they are nice and bright. We liked them so well we ordered more. I would recommend these for the quality and the price. :)
customer_reviews.author: John 35

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper quality materials than identical 2 year old light
customer_reviews.text: Received today. First one worked fine. However when I put the second one in the ground, it broke off where the glass meets the base. Is very top heavy and of a cheaper feeling material than the one I bought in 2015. The one from 2015 no longer worked so bought these to replace it. Had to use part of the old one to be able to use the broken one. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Bright clear light, nice glass shades, doesn't shine in your eyes – perfect for paths & steps.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, these cast a very bright light. The shade design keeps the light angled down, so it's perfect for lighting steps and paths so you can see where you're walking without the light shining in your eyes. I put them together and installed them in about ten minutes. Other reviewers said the fixture that attaches the light to the stakes breaks easily, so I was forewarned and handled that part with care. Seems sturdy enough to me! Also, the lamp shade is nice, heavy, high quality glass, with ripples that diffuse the light in a pleasing way.
customer_reviews.author: Kia Heavey

customer_reviews.title: Plastic, not metal as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Probably better than most solar path lights. The top and post are plastic as well as the stake. I have at least a dozen of these that I have purchased over the last two years. On the older units, the paint has faded horribly, so we may try to paint them using a spray paint for plastics. The light output and pattern are good. We are still using the original batteries.
customer_reviews.author: pams

customer_reviews.title: quality has declined
customer_reviews.text: Only one light worked. This was very disappointing since I have four other lights from the same manufacture that have worked great for three years. I already have them installed in my yard and it would be a huge pain to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Very bright solar lights.
customer_reviews.text: These are very bright solar lights that stay lighted for many hours. I've bought several sets over the last couple of years. HOWEVER, I recently purchased another set, and one of the two did not work. This product has been so good in the past that I immediately threw away the packaging. As I discovered the next day--actually the next night, one of the two lights did not work. Thinking that the batteries that were included might have been old or bad, I bought some rechargeable outdoor batteries at the local home improvement store, and that did not make this light work either.
customer_reviews.author: Karen P.

customer_reviews.title: Lasting a pretty long time so far
customer_reviews.text: These are really decent lights. It's been about 5 months and they're still shining bright for me, and lasting a pretty long time each night. The only thing keeping this from being a 5-star review is that some of them have tops that aren't locking right with the glass, so the tops are just kind of resting on it instead of being secure. So far I've had that problem with 2 out of 6 lights.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Brightest solar lights I ever saw. You could read a newspaper under them. I can see them 700 feet down the road when approaching my house. Right now they come on at 8:30 and at 6:30 the next morning they are still full bright. I didn't have a problem with the stake. I also bought some one inch copper pipe and couplings and extended the height by 12 inches. You need a coupling for the stake and one for the lamp itself. A bit of electrical tape around the base of the lamp makes it a tighter fit into the coupling. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: So worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I really only needed 2 solar lights to illuminate the steps in front of our door (we couldn't take a chance of the pizza deliver guy injuring himself in the dark and refusing service to us!) so I decided to try these. They are lovely... I love the pattern of light and shadows that is made on the ground. They have great illumination, even with all the mature trees in our yard. I wasn't sure if they would get enough sunlight to be effective but they work great. Also, I was very careful with installation based on other reviews and had no issue at all. These seem to be very well made and very much worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: SweetPea

customer_reviews.title: Very bright!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are bright! And they barely get much sun through out the day. I couldn't be happier with these lights. I am purchasing more! Just wish they were a bit cheaper since I will be buying at least 5 more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 6 of these in mid February of 2017. One has already failed. Tried to contact Moonrays regarding unit and no response after a week. Be cautious buying these as they are expensive and prone to failure. Would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: UnclearPhysics

customer_reviews.title: Four years later, and still on the original batteries.
customer_reviews.text: We have had these lights for four years. We bought two from Amazon in 2014, and they are still going strong on the original batteries. I keep wanting to add more, but never get around ordering more. I was browsing through my order history, and realized that I have had these lights for four years. I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Van Buskirk

customer_reviews.title: Very large head can look out of place in small areas
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is they are much larger than you imagine (the head) Almost 7.5 inches. Doesn't look right in a planter or smaller garden. Quality however is top notch. Would have loved to be able to keep them but too big for me. Company that provides make you pay for the return ($35 on a 125 order). Ouch. Amazon however credited me for the return charges. Love amazon.
customer_reviews.author: lucky 7

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought these a long time ago and would have saved money from spending money on the lesser quality ones and replacing them frequently. These are MUCH larger than the cheap ones from the local hardware store and are glass. They TOTALLY light up the whole front yard. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright, good-looking lights
customer_reviews.text: This is my second patch and they all still work great. I have them between bushes and next to a wall but they still get enough light to do the job Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: Light up brightly even on dreary days.
customer_reviews.text: I took this photo after the second gray, snowy day, about p2 hours after sunset. The lights shine brightly even after 2 days of dreariness. I bought and placed these lights about 2 months ago in November. As of January 14 they are still bright and last about 7-8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: These lights are great. Very high class and BRIGHT solar light
customer_reviews.text: These lights are great. Very high class and BRIGHT solar light. I have 20 of them around my pool deck and I always get complements on them. For people complaining about the plastic stakes, you need to hammer the stake into the ground FIRST BEFORE YOU ATTACH IT TO THE LIGHT. If you try to jam the light in the ground with the stake attached already to it you'll break them off if you lean it at an angle. Hammer the stake into the ground first then mount the light on it and you won't have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: nobodyinparticular

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. Waste of money! Bought two sets of these but they do not last, especially in a hot climate. I live in Southern California where it can get to 100 degrees in the summer. The batteries are not encased in anything to protect them, so the batteries melt when it is hot outside and battery acid ruins the inside battery holder. They are ruined.
customer_reviews.author: D. Falasca

product_meta.title: Moonrays 91754 Richmond Solar Metal Path, 360-degree display and 120-degree beam angle of warm LED, 30 Lumens, Automatic Lighting, Rubbed Bronze Finish, 2 Pack, 2-Pack, 2
product_meta.description:
The Moonrays 91754 Richmond-Style Path Light adds a decorative touch to your pathway, patio or garden, all while taking advantage of solar energy. Made of metal, this light has a rubbed bronzed finish and ribbed glass lens that provide a 360-degree display and 120-degree beam angle of LED lighting. The convex lens has wider ribbing which provide greater light output and enlarge the area of illumination. This light comes in a 2-pack and each LED is 25x brighter than traditional 1.2-lumen solar lights. The LED bulb will never need to be replaced and will remain cool to the touch at all times. This Richmond 91754 is Moonrays brightest light. Moonrays solar lights gather energy from the sun during the day, then automatically come on at dusk to provide a pattern of light exactly where you want it. The (3) rechargeable batteries (included) charge using the sun's rays and advanced Moonrays solar technology to provide light for up to 8-hours on a full battery charge. Moonrays lights are brighter because they put out more LUX than regular solar lights, which is the measurable amount of light that falls on the ground (area of illumination). The Moonrays 91754 Richmond-Style Path Light can provide safety and security while enhancing the beauty of your home. Each light emits 30-lumens from the .35-watt LED, has a 48-inch area of illumination and 14-inch above ground height. The Moonrays 91754 Richmond-Style Path Light comes with a 1-year limited warranty, provided to the original purchaser, which protects this product from manufacturing defects in material, assembly and workmanship. Coleman Cable, Inc. is a leading manufacturer and innovator of electrical and electronic wire and cable products for the security, sound, telecommunications, electrical construction, retail, commercial, industrial, irrigation, HVAC and automotive markets. Coleman Cable, Inc. offers a family of leading brands such as Designers Edge, Yellow Jacket, Woods and Moonrays.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Moonrays 91754 Richmond Style Solar Light, Metal Path Light, LED is 25X-Brighter, Rubbed Bronze, 2-Pack Premium Solar Path lights should be more bright than others, and more sturdy. We designed these to be both, with Bright White light and a durable Metal frame with glass lens. Traditional solar lights put out 1.25 lumens, but these put out and astounding 30 lumens per fixture! They're our Brightest solar lights listed as 24X brightness! The frame is constructed of metal with a rubbed bronze finish. Also the ribbed glass lens construction with ribbed glass lens creates a light beam that puts out 120-degree wide angle to cover more than average. Each purchase gives you 2-light fixtures, perfect for steps and outdoor staircases. This is a 2-pack. For more technical information, each fixture has 2 x .35Watt LEDs. 30 Lumens per fixture. The unit comes pre-assembled with a pre-charged AA NiMH batteries (includes 3- (1500mAh) AA NiMH Re-chargeable batteries). Runs up to 8 hours on a full charge. 48-inch area of illumination.. A solar lamp is a portable light fixture composed of a LED lamp, a photovoltaic solar panel, and a rechargeable battery. Solar panel on top the lamp recharges the battery with sunlight. Solar lamps recharge during the day. At dusk, they turn on automatically and remain illuminated overnight, depending on how much sunlight they receive during the day. Battery Type is NiMH. Moonrays lamps are Brighter because they put out more LUX than regular solar lamps. LUX is the measurable amount of light that falls on the ground from a lamp. Moonrays solar lamp take all design factors into consideration to give premium light output. We don't just stop at the lumens. We consider the solar panel, circuit design, batteries, LEDs, and optical design to attain the greatest LUX possible. TOLL FREE HOTLINE, 1-800-561-4321. If you have immediate questions about application, installation, troubleshooting, or a damaged component, please call CCI Consumer product hotline at 1-800-561-4321 or email questions to: CCI.ConsumerSupport@southwire.com.
feature_bullets: BRIGHT SOLAR PATH LIGHTS: the solar path lighting is 30 lumens warm white LED which is 25 times brighter than standard path lights; this means you’ll get brightly-lit paths and passageways. Ribbed glass lens provides a 360-degree display and 120-degree beam angle of warm LED lighting

SAVING OUTDOOR SOLAR PATH LIGHTS: these solar path lights make use of the sun to charge the AANiMH battery within and automatically switches on at dusk and off at dawn; so you enjoy more energy savings while not having to manually operate the solar pathlights. Run Time (Fully Charged)- 6-8 hours on full charge

EASYI NSTALLATION: it’s effortless to install the outdoor solar pathlights wherever you need them to be. Simply push the stake into the softearth and charge for a full day before using. Comes in a 2-pack and each LED is 25xbrighter than traditional 1.2-lumen solarlights. Moon rays brightest light

STYLISH GARDEN PATH SOLAR LIGHTS: with an elegant ribbed bronze finish and a big glass lens in ribbed design for optimal light output. This LED solar path light is a priceless fixture for illuminating a dark path or lane. Emits 30-lumens from the 35-wattLED. Has a 48-inch area of illumination and 14-inch above ground height

Outdoor path solar lights dimensions: Measures 18.5 inches from top to bottom; above ground height. After installation is approximately 14 inches depending on the depth you install the stake. Comes with a limited 1-year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars991 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
